Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Reticence \Ret"i*cence\, n. [L. reticentia: cf. F. r['e]ticence.] 1. The quality or state of being reticent, or keeping silence; the state of holding one's tonque; refraining to speak of that which is suggested; uncommunicativeness. [1913 Webster]
Such fine reserve and noble reticence. --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]
2. (Rhet.) A figure by which a person really speaks of a thing while he makes a show as if he would say nothingon the subject. [1913 Webster]
reticence n : the trait of being uncommunicative; not volunteering anything more than necessary [syn: {reserve}, {taciturnity}]
